required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Masking on Subjective Results During Daily Disposable Contact Lens Studies
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Masking on Subjective Results During Daily Disposable Contact Lens Studies

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the effect of masking on subjective ratings for two daily disposable contact lenses.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Insertion, 4 hours, 8 hours each: Day 1, Day 2, and Day 3
primary_outcome.description: Participants were asked, "How would you rate your comfort with your study lenses?" and indicated their response by marking a continuum line ranging from 0=very poor comfort to 100=excellent comfort. Subjective comfort was collected at three time points (insertion, 4 hours, 8 hours) for 3 days, and the comfort ratings were averaged together.

arm_group.description: Nelfilcon A worn in adaptation phase (bilaterally, 30 days). Period 1: 1DAVM and DACP (masked) worn contralaterally in random assignment for 3 days. Period 2: 1DAVM and DACP (unmasked) worn contralaterally, same assignment, 3 days. All products worn in a daily wear, daily disposable mode.

Nelfilcon A worn in adaptation phase (bilaterally, 30 days). Period 1: 1DAVM and DACP (masked) worn contralaterally in random assignment for 3 days. Period 2: 1DAVM and DACP (partially masked) worn contralaterally, same assignment, 3 days. All products worn in a daily wear, daily disposable mode.

Etafilcon A worn in adaptation phase (bilaterally, 30 days). Period 1: 1DAVM and DACP (masked) worn contralaterally in random assignment for 3 days. Period 2: 1DAVM and DACP (unmasked) worn contralaterally, same assignment, 3 days. All products worn in a daily wear, daily disposable mode.

Etafilcon A worn in adaptation phase (bilaterally, 30 days). Period 1: 1DAVM and DACP (masked) worn contralaterally in random assignment for 3 days. Period 2: 1DAVM and DACP (partially masked) worn contralaterally, same assignment, 3 days. All products worn in a daily wear, daily disposable mode.

intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and lens packaging visible to participant. Lenses inserted and removed by participant.

intervention.intervention_name: Nelfilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (DACP), unmasked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens with comfort additive for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and lens packaging visible to participant. Lenses and removed inserted by participant.

intervention.intervention_name: Nelfilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (DACP), masked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and packaging not visible to participant. Lenses inserted and removed by the investigator.

intervention.intervention_name: Nelfilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (DACP), partially masked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Lens name and manufacturer on blister pack label concealed from participant. Lenses inserted and removed by the participant.
Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and lens packaging visible to participant. Lenses inserted and removed by participant.

intervention.intervention_name: Etafilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (1DAVM), unmasked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens with comfort additive for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and lens packaging visible to participant. Lenses inserted and removed by participant.

intervention.intervention_name: Etafilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (1DAVM), masked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Blister pack label and packaging not visible to participant. Lenses inserted and removed by the investigator.

intervention.intervention_name: Etafilcon A contact lens with comfort additive (1DAVM), partially masked
intervention.description: Commercially marketed, soft, hydrogel contact lens for daily wear, daily disposable use. Lens name and manufacturer on blister pack label concealed from participant. Lenses inserted and removed by the participant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 17 years of age or older.
- Ocular exam within 2 years.
- Currently wearing soft contact lenses on a daily wear basis.
- Contact lens prescription between +6.00D and -10.00D.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any ocular disease.
- Use of systemic or ocular medications that may affect ocular health.
- Unable to achieve an acceptable fit with the study lenses.
- Anisometropia >1.00D or astigmatism >0.75D.
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Centre for Contact Lens Research: University of Waterloo

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 134 participants were recruited and enrolled at 1 study center located in Canada. A 24-hour washout period of no lens wear preceded the 30-day adaptation phase.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 18 participants were enrolled but not dispensed--i.e., discontinued prior to the 30-day adaptation phase. 116 participants started the adaptation phase, and baseline characteristics are presented for this group. 2 discontinued during the adaptation phase and 15 discontinued between adaptation and Period 1 dispense. 99 were dispensed into Period 1.

group.title: Nelfilcon A, Masked, Unmasked
group.description: Nelfilcon A in adaptation phase. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, masked) in Period 1. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, unmasked) in Period 2.

group.title: Nelfilcon A, Masked, Partially Masked
group.description: Nelfilcon A in adaptation phase. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, masked) in Period 1. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, partially masked) in Period 2.

group.title: Etafilcon A, Masked, Unmasked
group.description: Etafilcon A in adaptation phase. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, masked) in Period 1. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, unmasked) in Period 2.

group.title: Etafilcon A, Masked, Partially Masked
group.description: Etafilcon A in adaptation phase. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, masked) in Period 1. 1DAVM and DACP (contralateral wear, partially masked) in Period 2.

group.title: Overall
group.description: This reporting group includes all enrolled and dispensed participants.

outcome.title: Average Subjective Comfort
outcome.description: Participants were asked, "How would you rate your comfort with your study lenses?" and indicated their response by marking a continuum line ranging from 0=very poor comfort to 100=excellent comfort. Subjective comfort was collected at three time points (insertion, 4 hours, 8 hours) for 3 days, and the comfort ratings were averaged together.
outcome.time_frame: Insertion, 4 hours, 8 hours each: Day 1, Day 2, and Day 3

measure.title: Average Subjective Comfort
measure.description: Participants were asked, "How would you rate your comfort with your study lenses?" and indicated their response by marking a continuum line ranging from 0=very poor comfort to 100=excellent comfort. Subjective comfort was collected at three time points (insertion, 4 hours, 8 hours) for 3 days, and the comfort ratings were averaged together.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study: 03 May 2010 through 01 February 2011.
reported_events.desc: This reporting group includes all enrolled and exposed participants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: For a period of 10 years, the clinical investigator must hold all trial-related information and documents confidential and must agree to obtain sponsor's written consent before discussing, presenting, publicizing, or otherwise disclosing any preclinical and/or clinical data or impressions from this trial.
